00005 # Atom format: (ddhhmmss, ip, port, protocol)

00007 class test_parser:
00008     def __init__(self, p):
00009         """ Reads files in a directory, then deletes them."""
00010         """ Also maintains a list of atoms """
00011         self.path = p
00012         self.atoms = [];
00013 
00014     def read(self):
00015         """ Reads files (snort binary dumps). Delete files when finished reading"""
00016         
00017         #info = os.walk(self.path)
00018         #for root, dirs, files in info:
00019             #for f in files:
00020                 #file_path = root + "/" + f
00021                 #os.system("sudo tcpdump -v -n -r " + file_path + " > asdf")
00022         f2 = open("test.txt", "r")
00023 
00024         # Only want IP for now. Skip if not IP
00025         while True:
00026             line = f2.readline()
00027             words = line.split(",")
00028             if not line:
00029                 break
00030 
00031             timestamp = words[0]
00032             destination = words[1]
00033             port = words[2]
00034             protocol = words[3]
00035             self.atoms.append((timestamp, destination, port, protocol));
00036 
00037         
00038         # Add a delimiter for EOF not elegant but it should work
00039         self.atoms.append(("EOF","EOF","EOF","EOF"))
00040         f2.close()
00041         #os.system("sudo rm asdf")
00042         #os.system("sudo rm " + file_path)
00043 
00044     def get_atom(self):
00045         """ Returns the first atom from the list. If the list is empty, read files to add more back into the list """
00046         
00047         if not self.atoms:
00048             self.read()
00049 
00050         if not self.atoms:
00051             return None
00052         else:
00053             return self.atoms.pop(0)
00054 
00055     def block(self, _atom):
00056         """ Takes an atom and writes a rule to block future instances """
00057         
00058         if not _atom:
00059             print "Empty atom"
00060             return -1
00061         else:
00062             (timestamp, destination, port, protocol) = _atom
00063             rules_file = "blacklist"
00064             f = open(rules_file, "a")
00065             f.write("\ndrop " + protocol + " $HOME_NET any <> " + destination + "." + port)
00066             f.close()
00067             return 1
